abstract.p: Hyundai Group lowers Chung Ju Yung's stake in Hyundai Motor Co by 6.1 percent, but shares, worth $179 million, are sold to domestic investors, raising suspicions that deals were prearranged to maintain Chung's influence (S)

block.p: Appearing to capitulate to government pressure to spin off its carmaking affiliate, the Hyundai Group, South Korea's largest conglomerate, lowered its founder's stake in Hyundai Motor Company by 6.1 percent. But the shares, worth around $179 million, were sold to domestic investors, raising suspicions that the deals were prearranged to maintain the influence of Hyundai Group's founder, Chung Ju Yung. The commission has asked Hyundai to identify the purchasers of Mr. Chung's shares.
